description.en: The subject provides an overview of different economic systems and the role of global institutions in the economy. The course deals with the challenges and solutions of different economic sectors and fields of activity.
description.et: Õppeaine annab ülevaate erinevatest majandussüsteemidest ning globaalsete institutsioonide rollist majanduses. Kursusel käsitletakse erinevate majandussektorite ja tegevusvaldkondade väljakutseid ning lahendusvõimalusi.

objectives.en: The aim of the course is to analyze varieties of capitalism, national and international economic governance structures, global institutions, and the links between trade, finance, and economic development. Also introduce specific institutions in global economic sectors and areas - climate, energy, ICT, etc. and their role in managing economic and financial crises. The discussions will be linked to the UN Sustainable Development Goals and the global opportunities and means to achieve them.
objectives.et: Õppeaine eesmärgiks on analüüsida kapitalismi erinevaid versioone, riiklikke ja rahvusvahelisi majanduse juhtimise struktuure, globaalseid institutsioone, kaubanduse, rahanduse ja majandusarengu seoseid. Samuti tutvustada konkreetseid institutsioone globaalsetes majandussektorites ja valdkondades - kliima, energeetika, IKT jne ning nende rolli majandus- ja finantskriiside juhtimisel. Arutelud seotakse ÜRO säästva arengu eesmärkidega ning globaalsete võimaluste ja vahenditega neid saavutada.

learning_outcomes.en:
A successful graduate of the course:
* Has knowledge of national and international economic regulatory institutions;
* Knows the development trends and development goals of different economic fields and
understands the current problems of achieving them.
* Understands the economic policy measures and experience used to manage various crises.

independent_work.et: Individual case study and critical essay (instructions in Moodle).

grade_preconditions.et:
Submission of individual work according to the deadlines set in Moodle.

There are five evaluation criteria of research and critique papers: focus (context, purpose, and coherence), development (details and evidence), organization (order and layout), style (clarity and precision), and conventions (language and grammar).

description.et: Introduction to the Global Governance: Issues and Challenges. International organizations as organizing principle of global governance. Failure of international organization and new challenges.
Key institutions and issues in global governance. Power and authority. Multinationals, nation-states, and local communities.
Global development governance: Example of The World Bank; Global financial governance: Example of IMF.
Global trade governance: Example of the WTO.
Securing the World, Governing Humanity: Example of the UN.
Regional governance and regional organizations:Example of the EU; Example of BRICS.
Policy governance in developed countries: Example of the OECD.
